note.p: Unitarian minister and journal editor. Started the divinity course at Edinburgh University in 1833, but left after one year. Minister of the Unitarian congregation at Bridport, Dorset, 1835–40; co-adjutor in chapel at South Place, Finsbury, London, 1840; Sunday lecturer at the Beaumont Institution, London, 1841. Subeditor of the Examiner, 1843; Spectator; Morning Chronicle, 1849. Subeditor of the Saturday Review, 1855; editor, 1868–83.
